repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
### Problem

`vim._watch.poll` has terrible performance.

### Solution

On linux use fswatch as a watcher backend if available.

---

- Add File watcher section to health:vim.lsp. Warn if watchfunc is watchdirs.
- Renamed `_watch.poll` -> `_watch.watchdirs`
- All watchfuncs now support `include_pattern` and `exclude_pattern`.
- Improve type annotations all around.
- Run related tests on all watchfunc backends
- Tidied and simplified tests
- Close the file watchers when the LSP client is stopped.

Relates to: #23291

### Future work

Add a [watchmen](https://facebook.github.io/watchman/) [watchfunc](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23291#issuecomment-1712422887)

Note to reviewers: Please review by commit.

comment_data.body: I think we should rename the method, it's not actually polling anymore but opposed to the watch method it sets up a watcher per directory
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,4 +49,33 @@ function M.check()
   end
 end
 
+local function check_watcher()
+  vim.health.start('vim.lsp: File watcher')
+  local watchfunc = vim.lsp._watchfiles._watchfunc
+  assert(watchfunc)
+  local watchfunc_name --- @type string
+  if watchfunc == vim._watch.watch then
+    watchfunc_name = 'libuv-watch'
+  elseif watchfunc == vim._watch.poll then
+    watchfunc_name = 'libuv-poll'

comment_data.body: I think we should still keep the description.

Isn't this redundant?
```suggestion
---@param opts watch.PollOpts? Additional options
```

@@ -198,7 +199,7 @@ end
 --- directory at path.
 ---
 ---@param path (string) The path to watch. Must refer to a directory.
----@param opts (table|nil) Additional options
+---@param opts watch.PollOpts? (table|nil) Additional options

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
---@param callback function The function called when new events occur.
```

@@ -221,4 +222,11 @@ function M.poll(path, opts, callback)
   return recurse_watch(path, opts, callback)
 end
 
+---@param path string The path to watch. Must refer to a directory.
+---@param opts table? Additional options. Unused
+---@param callback function The function called when new events

comment_data.body: I would appreciate some comments in this file :)
No. it's to control the doc-gen. Which this `(table|nil)` will be documented.

Because that is a part of the type.

comment_data.diff_hunk:

 --- directory at path.

 ---@param path (string) The path to watch. Must refer to a directory.
----@param opts (table|nil) Additional options

comment_data.body: Right but it's part of the "public API" of this module (and yeah the module itself is private but still).

Should we maybe also mention here that `fswatch` is recommended?
```suggestion
  • On Linux, `fswatch` (recommended) is used a the backend if available, otherwise
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -335,6 +335,9 @@ The following changes to existing APIs or features add new behavior.
 
 • The `workspace/didChangeWatchedFiles` LSP client capability is now enabled
   by default.
+  • On Mac or Windows, `libuv.fs_watch` is used as the backend.
+  • On Linux, `fswatch` is used a the backend if available, otherwise

So does this mean that you agree with me on removing the `(table|nil)`?

comment_data.body: Done. I just removed the reverse mapping since it's not used.

I don't think this should be included and that all watchfuncs should try to support the same set of options. I've begun that here by adding universal support for `include_pattern` and `exclude_pattern`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,101 +1,129 @@
-local M = {}
 local uv = vim.uv
 
----@enum vim._watch.FileChangeType
-local FileChangeType = {
+local M = {}
+
+--- @enum vim._watch.FileChangeType
+--- Types of events watchers will emit.
+M.FileChangeType = {
   Created = 1,
   Changed = 2,
   Deleted = 3,
 }
 
---- Enumeration describing the types of events watchers will emit.
-M.FileChangeType = vim.tbl_add_reverse_lookup(FileChangeType)
-
---- Joins filepath elements by static '/' separator
+--- @class vim._watch.Opts
 ---
----@param ... (string) The path elements.
----@return string
-local function filepath_join(...)
-  return table.concat({ ... }, '/')
-end
-
---- Stops and closes a libuv |uv_fs_event_t| or |uv_fs_poll_t| handle
+--- An |lpeg| pattern. Only changes to files whose full paths match the pattern
+--- will be reported. Only matches against non-directoriess, all directories will
+--- be watched for new potentially-matching files. exclude_pattern can be used to
+--- filter out directories. When nil, matches any file name.
+--- @field include_pattern? vim.lpeg.Pattern
 ---
----@param handle (uv.uv_fs_event_t|uv.uv_fs_poll_t) The handle to stop
-local function stop(handle)
-  local _, stop_err = handle:stop()
-  assert(not stop_err, stop_err)
-  local is_closing, close_err = handle:is_closing()
-  assert(not close_err, close_err)
-  if not is_closing then
-    handle:close()
+--- An |lpeg| pattern. Only changes to files and directories whose full path does
+--- not match the pattern will be reported. Matches against both files and
+--- directories. When nil, matches nothing.
+--- @field exclude_pattern? vim.lpeg.Pattern
+
+--- @alias vim._watch.Callback fun(path: string, change_type: vim._watch.FileChangeType)
+
+--- @class vim._watch.watch.Opts : vim._watch.Opts
+--- @field uvflags? uv.fs_event_start.flags
+
+--- @param path string
+--- @param opts? vim._watch.Opts
+local function skip(path, opts)
+  if not opts then
+    return false
+  end
+
+  if opts.include_pattern and opts.include_pattern:match(path) == nil then
+    return true
+  end
+
+  if opts.exclude_pattern and opts.exclude_pattern:match(path) ~= nil then
+    return true
   end
+
+  return false
 end
 
 --- Initializes and starts a |uv_fs_event_t|
 ---
----@param path (string) The path to watch
----@param opts (table|nil) Additional options
----     - uvflags (table|nil)
----                Same flags as accepted by |uv.fs_event_start()|
----@param callback (function) The function called when new events
----@return (function) Stops the watcher
+--- @param path string The path to watch
+--- @param opts vim._watch.watch.Opts? Additional options:
+---      - uvflags (table|nil)

comment_data.body:
Then why haven't you removed the redundancy?

EDIT: Nvm I was looking at the wrong diff

 ---

comment_regular_data.body: I'm happy to update any existing tests so they cover both backends.

> I'm happy to update any existing tests so they cover both backends.

See test/functional/lua/watch_spec.lua and https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/0e9a33572dc752463a0f5ad8a08a2c494d7a42e1/test/functional/plugin/lsp_spec.lua#L4361-L4362

Unrelated nit but since we're already touching this file, is this function really needed? It's a simple one-liner used in a single place.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/57affc3307a0d6b3a60fe4348a8d3fde8d6f2891/runtime/lua/vim/_watch.lua#L14-L20

Trying to get all the backends crossed with all the platforms to agree on exact events was a bit tricky since different API calls can cause different events in any one combination.

For example `io.open` on Linux appears to cause a `Create` event with `fswatch`, however Windows with any backend requires `file:close()` to cause the `Created` event.

In practice these "event inconsistencies" are benign but does make testing a little awkward.

I've worked around it by creating files by renaming a temporary file which is how vim saves files internally anyway.

Hopefully that makes CI happy give or take some more random delays. 🤞
Just found we weren't cancelling the file watchers when closing the client. Added a fix here.

title: feat(lsp): add fswatch watchfunc backend
